critique: This document adjusts cost of living allowances for federal employees. It suspends certain requirements related to consideration of quarters, subsistence, and purchasing privileges when determining these allowances. It also directs the Civil Service Commission to study problems associated with the implementation of the relevant section of the US Code and submit recommendations. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power expansion, federalism implications, national security concerns, or social inclusion considerations. The economic regulation aspect is minimal, dealing with adjustments to existing allowances rather than broad economic policy changes.
